derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from re- 'back, again' + obsolete imburse 'put in a purse', from medieval Latin imbursare, from in- 'into' + late Latin bursa 'purse'

entry.def: If you reimburse someone for something, you pay them back the money that they have spent or lost because of it.

example.ex: I'll be happy to reimburse you for any expenses you might have incurred...
example.tran: 我将很乐意赔偿您所发生的任何费用。

example.ex: The funds are supposed to reimburse policyholders in the event of insurer failure.
example.tran: 这项基金将在保险公司不能偿付的情况下对投保人进行赔付。

means.word_mean: 1. pay back for some expense incurred;

sentences.sentence: "Can the company reimburse me for my professional travel?"

means.word_mean: 2. reimburse or compensate (someone), as for a loss

auth_sentence.content: He refused to reimburse the Wises, who ultimately sued.

sentences.en: We’ll reimburse you for your travelling expenses.
Any costs that you incur will be reimbursed in full.
sentences.cn: 你的所有花费都将全额付还。

sentences.en: Any out-of-pocket expenses incurred on the firm’s business will be reimbursed.
sentences.cn: 由公司业务产生的开销都可以报销。

sentences.en: Employees are reimbursed for any legal fees incurred when they relocate.
sentences.cn: 员工调往异地工作时，他们可以报销由此产生的所有法律服务费用。
